snippet: HAUBEN--Ben, of Dorset, VT, died on March 8, 2016. He was 73. He was a real estate developer, philanthropist and patron of the arts. Along with his wife, Lana Hauben, he developed Manchester Designer Outlets, a luxury outlet center in the heart of Manchester Center, VT. His innovative approach to quality design attracted many of the finest names in retail. He leaves behind his beloved wife, Lana Hauben of Dorset, VT, his daughters, Alissa Hauben, Laura Hauben and Jill Hauben and his adored grandchildren, Bruce, Natalie and David Appel of Scarsdale, NY. Lola and Ari Label of San Francisco and Ellis Hauben of Portland, Or as well as his sister, Cyla Klein of NYC. 1/3
lead_paragraph: HAUBEN--Ben, of Dorset, VT, died on March 8, 2016. He was 73. He was a real estate developer, philanthropist and patron of the arts. Along with his wife, Lana Hauben, he developed Manchester Designer Outlets, a luxury outlet center in the heart of Manchester Center, VT. His innovative approach to quality design attracted many of the finest names in retail. He leaves behind his beloved wife, Lana Hauben of Dorset, VT, his daughters, Alissa Hauben, Laura Hauben and Jill Hauben and his adored grandchildren, Bruce, Natalie and David Appel of Scarsdale, NY. Lola and Ari Label of San Francisco and Ellis Hauben of Portland, Or as well as his sister, Cyla Klein of NYC. 1/3
